constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LHA Maximum Height Level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet).
LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 300 metres in height (984.2 feet)
100Y Name: North Enfield ModelDescription: 100YRCC2402Scenario: 1 in 100 year plus climate change allowance
CILRES CIL ZONE: Lower Rate Eastern Zone - RATE: £40 per square metre
DMDAAP Designation: Area Action Plan- Area: North East Enfield- Policy: Core policy 40

description: Change of use from Use Class C3 (dwelling house) to Use Class C4 (HMO-house in multiple occupation) with associated amenity, cycle and refuse storage.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Location Plan Block PlanBDRR-1635-119BDRR-1635-118BDRR-1635-11BDRR-1635-55BDRR-1635-12BDRR-1635-13BDRR-1635-662BDRR-1635-558BDRR-1635-663BDRR-1635-559Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The use of the property as a House in Multiple Occupation hereby approved shall be occupied by a maximum of 5 people at any one time acting as a single household and shall not be subdivided or occupied as self-contained units. Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to safeguard the residential character of the surrounding area.

No independent cooking or laundry facilities shall be installed in any of the respective bedrooms and the communal kitchen / dining rooms shall be retained in perpetuity.Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to safeguard the amenity of neighbours and the residential character of the surrounding area

Prior to occupation of the development, details of source control SuDS shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Authority. Source control SuDS measures include green roofs, rain gardens and permeable paving. The details must include plans, specifications and maintenance information. Reason: To ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, DMD Policy 61, and Policies SI12 & SI13 of the London Plan and the NPPF and to maximise opportunities for sustainable development, improve water quality, biodiversity, local amenity and recreation value.

The development herby permitted shall not be occupied until details of means of enclosure for the frontage of the subject site have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied or use commences.Reason: To ensure a safe, secure, and accessible environment for all users of the development, including vehicles, pedestrians, and cyclists, and to maintain the visual quality and functionality of the site.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of the 5 long-stay cycle parking spaces have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These details should demonstrate:Location : in an accessible location: the access route to the cycle parking enclosures should be a minimum of 1.2m wide to enable the bike to enter the store, should be step free and involve no more than 2 doors or gates (excluding the store door) which must also have a minimum opening width of 1.2mDesign: Stands or wall bars Security: Secure, overlooked, well-lit Coverage: Covered where possible Accessibility: Step-free, no obstructions The cycle parking spaces shall be fully constructed in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation and shall thereafter be retained for the lifetime of the development. Reason: To ensure that adequate cycle parking facilities are provided to promote sustainable modes of transport.
